text: Aye sir.
Aye, sir.
Do you mind if I ask you a question about the Bynars?
Fine, Captain. I am just trying to learn something about the Bynars.
Holodeck Four. Shall I call him for you, sir?
How can humanoids process information at that speed?
How did you happen to develop this ability?
I'm getting an indication of possible trouble in Main Engineering.
Maybe it's just how a different species behaves.
Not very much. I'm reading a problem with the magnetic field which contains the antimatter. Could you come up here?
To have a society so interdependent on computers has tremendous advantages.
What is that high-speed sound you make?
Yes, sir.
You act like you don't believe them.
At warp seven... thirty-four minutes.
Aye aye, sir.  It's good to have you back.
Aye, sir.
Aye, sir.
Course laid in, Captain.
Data -- any guesses as to what this is all about?
Full impulse -- aye, Commander.
In other words, you don't know either.
Orbiting the pulsar at fifty million kilometers, sir.
Sir?
But the transporter biofilter is supposed to kill stuff like that.
Captain Picard!
I can't smell anything. I'm a little congested...
Mom...
No problem, sir. The Holodeck has all you'll ever need.
Skiing, sir. Our instructor has us scheduled for the Swiss Alps, sir.
This is worse than Hesperan Thumping Cough. What is it, Mom?
We, ah, finished our ski lesson, sir... and it kinda just happened, sir.
Yes, sir!!
But, Mom, this is important!
I don't know. Engineering has nothing like it on record.
I know you're busy, Mom, but when I went back to the main sensors in Engineering to try some more sensitivity experiments...
If you'll scan heading four-four mark one-six-three, Lieutenant, you'll find...
It could take a few moments, Captain. If they build up their beaming energy through capacitors as seems likely...
It's an old style starship, Constitution Class, heading this way under impulse power, sir.
Sir! You'll soon be getting an intruder alert!
Some day. Right now I'm happy to be here.
Uh... says the long distance sensors, sir. I was in Engineering, playing around with boosting sensor output...
Well... sometimes it determines exactly what you don't know.
Yes, ma'am...  ... if that's what you're talking about there. I don't know anything about brain scans but I glanced at these when you were studying them, Mom, and I noticed...
Yes, sir.
Yes, sir.
You're welcome, ladies.  Adults!
Commander?... I've studied all the technical manuals on the Holodeck. I think I could be of some help down there.
I don't know if I should. If this isn't done correctly, the program could abort and everyone inside could vanish.
I've found three --
No, sir. Whether we do it now or later, the risk will be the same.
Teenage mating rituals?
Thank you sir.
A long time.  But not any more. Not even a little, sir.
Because you led the mission. You came back. My father didn't.
But I know what it'll be like for him.
Ensign Crusher reporting as ordered, sir.
He had to do the same thing for me.
Hi.
How can you ever get used to it... to telling them... ?
I don't know. I guess... I just didn't want to think about it any more, you know... all this has reminded me so much of that day...
I just tried to be what everybody expected me to be. Brave. Mature.
I was angry.  At you.
Like somebody kicked me right in the brain.
Me? What for?
My parents taught me about the dangers of starfleet missions. I knew it could happen.
No, I don't think I was. Not really. How could anyone be... prepared to hear that his dad is... never coming home again.
No.
Okay. Let me think about it.
Sometimes I can't quite remember his face... it scares me.
They're very careful to prepare us for... anything. Still...
Today... it's like I can see it all as clearly as if it were yesterday... the way he looked when he hugged me good-bye... Captain Picard's eyes when he came to tell us...
What would I tell him?
You ever think about him, Mom?
"Uh oh"... it's an expression, Data. It just means, you know, uh oh, something's wrong...
Commander La Forge had a big date with Christy tonight. He's been working on the perfect program for days. Looks like it ended kinda early.
Engines are not responding, sir.
I'm getting fluctuating waveguide readings...
Not much of it left, is there...
Right.
Sir, there's no response.
The main power return is acting a little weird...
This was the final battle, wasn't it?
Uh oh...
Yes, sir!
Yes, sir.
Yessir.
And our best shot barely scratched the surface.
Approaching the Paulson Nebula, sir...
Commander, if the Borg stay at warp nine-point-six, we'll be forced to discontinue pursuit and power down in less than three hours.
Got another king in the hole, Data?
I don't think so. I fold.
I'm in for ten...
I'm in.
Knock out one generator and another takes over without interruption.
Mine too.
No, that's okay...
Sir, they did it... the Borg ship is dropping out of warp...
The field is getting too dense, sir...
The main deflector dish.
We'll need to evacuate the entire forward half of the secondary hull. And the lower three decks of the saucer.
We're in business.
Aye, Captain.
Borg tractor beam attempting to lock on, Captain...
Captain, the Borg ship... it's moving away...
Captain, we're approaching the Wolf system.
Enterprise approaching the Terran system, sir...
Forty-two minutes, sir.
It's resuming its course to Earth, sir...
Riker Alpha, confirmed...
Riker Beta, confirmed...
Saucer velocity one hundred meters per second and increasing.
The Borg tractor beam has moved toward the anti-matter spread.
The saucer section... it's a sitting duck...
They're gonna make it...
They're ignoring the saucer section completely...
Twenty-seven minutes...
Twenty-three minutes, fourteen seconds, sir.
Two minutes, four seconds...
Yessir.
... What's its power source?
Captain, I think I figured out their computer controls -- I'm not sure, it's a different system than ours.
Custodian's room.
Custodian, can you show me where Harry is?
Custodian, show me Alexandra.
Custodian, show me Jason...
Custodian, this is Wesley Crusher.
Custodian, what's in the locked room next to this one?
Custodian, what's your instruction set?
Do you want me to guess?
Does Captain Picard know what you are doing?
Excuse me, sir, where are you taking Tara?
From time to time, every computer -- I mean Custodian -- requires maintainance.
Harry, don't touch that!
Harry, we all have to do this together or it won't work.
He will. It just might take him a little while.
Hello, Custodian. I'm Wesley Crusher.
How can I command your attention? Do you have a non-maskable interrupt?
How did you know my name?  Oh, through that energy beam.
How do they cloak the planet?
I don't know that either.
I don't know who.
I knew the captain would get us home.
I know that. But maybe they don't.
I know you're hungry. We all are, but Alexandra, we are not going to eat anything. It's our way of telling them that we want to go home. Do you understand?
I know. We all are, but it's going to be all right. Everyone knows where we are. No one is going to hurt you. I promise.  Alexandra, don't go too far!
I need your help. I have an idea how we can get home.
I will, Mom.
I won't.

I'm learning a lot. They have a computer which they call the Custodian. It controls everything.  The captain should know this. All their defense systems, the city's environment, everything. And it's all voice command. So simple. But the amazing thing is the Aldeans don't know how it works. They know how to talk to it, but they don't even know what its power source is, and they didn't do the original programming.
If you don't know how it works, how can you repair it?
It was scary at first, but I really didn't feel anything.
It will take years for him to learn to do that.
It's called "passive resistance." We don't do anything they want us to do and then they won't want us.
It's probably the power source.
Like a family.
Mom!
Oh. I thought... never mind.
Okay, really okay. Everyone's been assigned their own units... you know, like families. We're being treated, well, almost like gods.
Show me Harry.
Show me where all the Enterprise children are in relation to this room.
Sir! We knew you'd come!
So do I, but I don't want to stay here forever. Do you?
Sorry, sir. She just wanted to give you a present for bringing her back to her mommy.
Thank you.
Thank you. Duana, what does the Custodian do?
Thank you. Good night.
Thank you. What does that mean?
That doesn't make any sense to me.
The Custodian -- who is the Custodian?
They said that later on, when I'm really an Aldean, I'll know all their secrets.
They won't hurt us.
Units?
We already have families.
We want to go home.
What about me? Don't I have a say in this?
What is its address?
What's in there?
When?
Who built it?
You are going to make Harry into a sculptor?
You can keep me here, but you can't make me want to stay. You'll never be able to make me forget. And I'll never be an Aldean.
You didn't eat anything.
He is on the Bridge, sir.
Navigation doesn't respond either, sir.
New course set for heading three-four-one mark two-two-one.
Not me, Commander.
Sir, we're at Warp nine-three!
Warp nine-point-three, sir.
We don't even know what star system we're in, sir.
When he transferred force field control to the Bridge he must have only specified fields he was planning to initiate. The quarantine field was already operating.
You're the only one who has clearance to localize command functions, sir.
... and that you knew Captain Picard when he was on the Stargazer.
About where you come from.
Aye, sir.
Aye, sir. Course for 'aucdet Nine has been input.
Aye, sir. Warp nine.
Captain, for right now... this is where I want to be. This is where I feel I belong.
Captain.
Captain... I have thought about this a lot. I want to remain on the Enterprise.
Come on, Commander.
Could I see you when you have a moment?
Everyone is very curious about you.
Hello, Captain.
I didn't mean the souffle, I meant for... well... the rest. Thanks.
I heard that you're from Nova Kron and that...
I try to.
I've got to go.
It is going to be hard to leave the Enterprise...
It will still be there.
It's all right. I can use the time to finish some projects.
No -- nothing. That's the third time you've asked me.
No, before I do that, I wanted your permission to stay.
No. I just wanted to stand here.
No. Nothing thank you.
Over there is the Lorenze cluster, and there Arneb and there Epsilon Indi.
People say you are very old...
Sometimes. Sometimes you have to consider others more than yourself.
Standard approach, aye.
Standard orbit, aye.
Thank you, sir.
Thank you.
The Shuttle Bay is secure.
Yes sir, they are.
Yes, but this isn't "any" ship.
Yes, sir.
Yes, sir... thank you sir... I just know she'll agree.
Yes.
Yes.
You never talk about yourself.
I haven't stepped one foot on your bridge, Captain...
Sir?
Yes sir!
Yes sir!
Yes sir.
As soon as I realized it was a trick question, there was only one answer.
Because of my father? Because Cap... someone made that choice and my father died.
Breathe. Gotta remember to breathe.
But a man died!
But on the Enterprise you do that every day. Everyone depends on everyone else to protect them.
Come on!
Course plotted and laid in, sir.
Did you hear that Mordock? She said I was cute!
Don't fight it. Relax into it and just do it automatically.
End of the corridor on your right. Room 406...
Gotta go.
Hello?
Help me move this!
Hey, Jake! Wait a second!
Hi. I'm Wesley Crusher.
How can they know what my deepest fear is when I don't?
How're you doing?
I apologize. An honest mistake, okay? I'm sorry.
I don't know. I think so. Maybe. I don't know.
I failed, Captain. I didn't get into the Academy. I failed you... and the Enterprise.
I hope so, sir.
I wanna scare myself. What do you think -- Bulgallian rats? Lightning storm?
I wish I felt that sure.
I'm here. I'm, uh, ready.
I'm on my way.
I'm real sorry...
I'm sorry, Lieutenant Worf. I shouldn't ask so many personal questions.
I'm sorry.
I'm through testing for the day.
I, um, thought you might want to have lunch... together.
I... I didn't think it would be appropriate.
It's okay. You deserved to win. Besides, you would've done the same thing for me.
Kinda. But's it's exciting, too. You know, that rolling feeling in your stomach?
Maybe they forgot.
Me too!
Me? No, you're the one. I've studied the Mordock Strategy...
Mom, I can't be late.
Mordock? Are you... all right?
Mordock? The Mordock? The Benzite who constructed the Mordock Strategy? I thought you already were in the Academy.
No! Stay. I thought I wanted to be by myself, but I guess I didn't really.
No, sir... I, he...
Not really. When he held up his hand, I could see it was webbed... the sign of a Zaldan.
Officer Chang! There's been an...
Oh, no, Oliana, it doesn't come easily. I have to study all the time. Mordock's the one who's brilliant.
Oh. It's a flux coordinating sensor.
Oh. Sorry.  You're not leaving., are you?
Oh... okay.

Okay. So far. It's not the ones I've studied for I'm worried about. It's the Psych Test, facing my deepest fear and living through it. I don't even know what it is. I'm trying to figure out what images to bring up.
Oliana!
Performance?!... That was the test.
Somebody help! Something's wrong in the lab!
Sure!
Thanks everybody. But it's not until next month.
Thanks for the party, everyone. And the good wishes.
That's what they said, but it's all I can think about.
The Psych Test, sir?
Then you got over it.
Then you're not disappointed?
Uh, I'll be sixteen next month.
Well, yes...
Well, you wouldn't be here if...
Wesley Crusher, from the Enterprise.
What?
Who do you think you're bullying? You bumped into me. It was your mistake. You were rude.  Do you want this to become violent?
Yeah! You know me?
Yes, I know, but I wish we were both going.
Yes, sir.
You have to help me!
You have to. I can't carry you both! You can walk. Come on.
You're a legend in the Galactic Computer Network...
You're doing all right...
You? I didn't think there was anything that could frighten a Klingon warrior.
You? You failed?
Zaldans are infuriated by courtesy. They see it as a form of phony social behavior, designed to hide real feelings.
Air and darkness?
Commander, Romulan vessel!
Four minutes, thirty-three seconds, sir.
How did you find out about all this?
I can't stop thinking about the Yamato. All those people -- dead. I just don't know how you do it. You, Commander Riker, Geordi, you all handle it so easily.
I'm trying, sir!
It's about the Iconians, sir. I'd always heard that they were just a myth.
Shields not responding.
Sir, another probe launched from the planet, heading for the Romulan.
Sir, may I talk to you for a minute?
Sir, the shields are up.
Sir, what about the away team? With our shields up we can't beam them back.
So they were warlike?
That sounds like magic.
The Iconians colonized those worlds?
The shields are back up.
Uh, shields are back down.
Why would the Romulans be having problems? They haven't been probed.
... that what I've said would have been listened to if it came from an adult officer. Request permission to return to my quarters, sir.
Aye, sir.
Captain, recommend you do not let...  ... him move around the ship alone.
Confirm! And so fast it makes our warp eight look like we're standing still!
Data, the Crystal Thing is outside close to the ship... and Lore is loose somewhere inside.
Data... !
Have you got a... a "cold?"
He indicated that, sir.
He said he "turned him off," Mom...  ... uh, Doctor.
How can you be practicing sneezing when you're arriving for the first time at your home planet? Aren't you interested in that?
I know, Mom. So tell me again to "shut up, Wesley," and I will.
I'd suggest you forget imitating him...  ... because if you had said "We've been using the sensors," instead if "we have," I might have suspected you were Lore.
It's Data! For once will you trust me about something?
It's Data, Mom. He's been hurt!
It's a disease my mother says people used to get.
Lore's gone, sir, permanently!
Mom!
Not if I have a choice.
Or is it Lore pretending to be Data, and faking it all?
Please, Mom. Let's go.
Since I am finished here, Captain, may I point out... ?
Sir, I know this may finish me as an acting ensign, but...
Sir... you asked for the kind of computer upgrade that only the Bynars can handle. And they're available only at this time.
What are you doing?
Which separates it from another three hundred-sixty degree full circle like this... on a right angle to that one.
Why did he do that, Data?
Yes sir!
Yes sir!
Yes, sir!
You must know how much Starfleet means to me. But I'm finished unless you can help me.  I heard you know how to turn them on. Please?
You'll find as I have that starships are loaded with rules which have to be learned.
A shape shifter?
A taste to remember me by.
Actually all you have to do is tell the computer what you want and it will prepare it for you.
And now she's returning.
And one day you'll visit Rosseau Five... and other places and more spectacular than this.
And then what?
Are you telling me to go yell at Salia?
Believe me, the Ten-Forward room is not an illusion.
But I thought you were going there to unite two groups which have been fighting.
But what are you really?
But what do I say? How should I act? What do I do?
Can you?
Come in.
Come in.
Come with me.
Commander Riker...
Data -- the girl who just came on board.
Data! I want to meet her, not dissect her.
Does Anya know you're here?
Done, Captain.
Energize.
For us both. Everything is just beginning. We've only charted nineteen percent of our galaxy... the rest is out there -- waiting for us. And already, look at what we've discovered.
Geordi, this girl they beamed up, she's... she's perfect! Perfect!
Geordi.  Oh... Yes.. I'm fine... I just...
Got to go. Thanks, Data.
How about something to drink?
I better get back to my duties.
I didn't expect you to say that.
I didn't say that.
I don't believe this! Who is she?
I don't know. what do you like?
I don't think this is my style.
I don't understand.
I had it on the wrong setting.
I know... Computer, Thalian chocolate mousse.
I loved you.
I never thought of it that way.
I will do as you ask.
I'll do better.
I'm glad you came. I thought Anya would have kept you with her.
I'm looking!
I'm never going to feel this way about anyone else.
I'm not in trouble... yet.
I'm on my way.
I've got my mind on something.
In other words, you slipped away.
Is something wrong?
Is that what awaits you on Daled Four?
It's one of my favorite places.
It's the best part of being on the Enterprise.
It's time we changed that.
Knowing that doesn't make it any easier.
Not her. The girl.
Nothing.
Now, listen. In a moment the orbits of the moons will become synchronous.
Oh, yes.
Oh, yes. And there are so many more -- all special - -all so different. And all the different kinds of life-forms.
Okay.
On Thalos Seven they age the cocoa beans four hundred years.
Playing humanoid. Was it fun?
Right away.
Salia!
Salia!  You shouldn't have come.
Salia, nothing is impossible!
Security to crew quarters!
Seeing her on the transporter pad was like seeing pure light.  I miss her. I feel so empty.
Soon you'll see it for yourself.
Sorry.
That makes you sad?
That's silly, Geordi.  Well, since you recommend it... If she'll talk to me, how should I approach her? What would I say?
Then, think of what you have to look forward to. This is the best time to be alive.
There's a way. I know there is!
There's almost nothing in the computer about her.
There's too many!
Very little. There is almost nothing in the ship's computer about Daled Four. What will you do there?
Wait!
Wait. Computer -- Rosseau Five.
Was it fun?
We have had enough disguises between us. It's time for the truth.
What can you tell me?
What does the man do?
What if nothing occurs to me?
What is it? What happened?
What usually does?
Who are you? No one mentioned we were beaming up such a... a...
Why not?
Why?
With my wild way of life?
Yes, well, that might work for Klingons, but I think I should try something less dangerous.
Yes.
Yes... It's a... say, how did you know that?
You already have.
You could stay.
You want me to stay away from Salia.
You've got to be joking. Just because I said she's interesting...
A neutrino pulse...
Captain -- the signal pattern from the neutrino beacon is modulating.
Captain, the neutrino beacon is operational. We've placed it aboard a class three probe.
He'll be able to show us that he's found it by modifying the pulse...
Just a background fluctuation, Commander... he hasn't found it yet.
No change in the neutrino beacon signal, sir.
We could build a portable neutrino source and send it in a probe to the surface. It would be like a beacon.
But we've got plenty of things left to try.
He wants the impossible.
Maybe if we bypassed the autosequence and decompiled the pattern buffer... ?
Sorry, sir.
Teremi-thorons.
They're one of the most elusive sub-atomic particles known, and they really shred a transporter signal.
Yes, sir.
Approaching ten million kilometers from the neutron star...
Are you okay?
But it's just a mechanical problem, right?
Do you recreate them on a Holodeck?
Doctor Stubbs, I want to go the Academy. But if I don't, I have other things to live for.
Doctor Stubbs...
Go ahead.
Go ahead....
Guinan, I'm scared. Everything that's been going wrong may be my fault.
Guinan... I didn't think anyone would be here.
How can you be so calm about everything? If I was about to make this kind of breakthrough...
I always get an A.
I can't, Eric. There's just too much to do...
I know.
I know. I will. If it's true.
I know. It's not that. I just...
I know. It's okay. Really.
I was just... I had some things to do...
I was pulling an all-nighter to get my final data... and I fell asleep. When I woke up, I realized the container was still open...  It was just a science project.
I'm an acting officer... I have responsibilities....
I'm just checking some traps that I set... to see if I can find out what's happening to the ship.
I'm just setting... traps.

I've been working on my final project for Advanced Genetics. It's on nanotechnology. And I've been studying the nanites we have in the Sickbay genetic supplies. They're just like tiny little robots with gigabytes of mechanical computer memory, tiny enough to enter living cells and conduct repairs. They're supposed to be strictly confined to the lab.
I've done everything anyone has asked of me and more. You don't know... you haven't even been here.
It's German, isn't it?
It's true. I'm reponsible. I allowed two of the nanites to interact for my school project to increase their capabilities. And... they escaped.
Mom, I think I've made a horrible mistake.
Mom, you don't understand...
My dad taught it to me when I was little.
My studies keep me pretty busy. I'm trying to get into the Academy... I earn credits for my work on the Enterprise... but it's not the same as being there...
Nobody will say that...
Oh... I can't... I have to check on Doctor Stubbs. He's in Sickbay...
One billionth of a second.
Red Alert. You should return to your quarters immediately.
The burden?
The captain asked me to tell you that our systems are back to normal and we can make another launch attempt as soon as you're ready.
The ship is not responding.
They're really harmless. They only have the most basic skills. It's almost impossible that they could be responsible...
They're running a check to find out what happened. Everything's okay now...
This is a sample of linear memory crystal from our computer core.

Two of them. That's all. See, I just wanted to see how they would interact and function in tandem. In my project, I had proposed a theory that they could actually combine their skills to improve their usefulness. And it was working.
Uh, yessir. I'm... very sorry. I'll be right there.
We're at forty million kilometers from the neutron star.
We're running out of time for Doctor Stubbs...
We're testing a low level gamma field that might reduce their processing speed.
When I heard we were going to be part of your experiment, I read all your published works.
Yessir.
You got it. Nice going, Geordi...
You won't tell anybody...
Computer, load program, Crusher One.
Do you know what it says?
Good-bye, Dad.
Run program.
What kind of message?
Why?
"Captain?" Of a mining shuttle?
And how do you know it'll go for my phaser, not yours?
And you were worried about how tough the Captain is?
Aye, sir.
Because I wanted you to be proud of me.
But I think I'm on to something. I've analyzed the sentry's electrical patterns.
But it didn't turn out the way I thought it would... you kind of -- opened up to me. I got to know you.  Sort of.
Captain Picard? Wake up...
Captain... ?
Captain... water!
Captain?  Captain Picard!
Captain? Remember when we took the shuttlecraft to Starbase Five-One-Five? I was dreading it... six hours alone with you...
Dirgo -- move!
Don't worry about Captain Picard -- he'll handle them.
Help me!
Hold on... we need to figure out what it is, before we start doing anything to it.
How did this happen?
How did you find us?
I can walk.
I don't know what it is. It just registers as a repeating energy pattern...
I know, sir, but --
I should've tried harder to stop him...
I think I can use it to interrupt the sentry's energy pattern... stop it.  Or at least slow it down...
I think I've been pretty lucky... no matter what happens. How many people get to serve with -- with Jean-Luc Picard?
I think so, sir. The scanning range may be limited, but it's better than nothing.
I was honored you wanted me along...
I'll be back soon.
I'll try, sir -- but this grid looks about a hundred years old...
I'm going to get to the water... I took the transponder element from my communicator... used it to modify the tricorder...
I'm not sure, sir... an energy reading.
I'm sure glad to see you...
I've lost navigation --
If I could find a way to manipulate the frequency, I might be able to control it.  The Sentry appeared when we started using phasers. Maybe it responds to heat... or to collinated energy...
If you want to get out of this, I suggest you listen. Captain Picard is the one who's going to keep us alive --
It seems to be some kind of tightly confined annular force field...
It worked... !
It's possible... the pattern's fairly organized...
Keep pressure on that wound!
Keep the pressure constant.
Low frequency E-M. It's been getting stronger... the closer we get to those mountains.
Mom!
Negative. But sensors are limited. There's an intense magnetic field near the surface.
No, he's not -- you're going to be fine...
No, sir, not at all, it was more of an explanation --
No, sir... But that E-M reading? The pattern has changed... and the frequency is peaking a lot higher...
No, we can't...
No... not yet...
Oh, yes sir! I mean -- no, sir.
One of the moons of Pentarus Three... it's class M -- barely -- mean temperature fifty-five degrees Celsius...
One thing I learned from you... is that you never quit. And I'm not quitting now. I've seen you think yourself out of worse problems... and I'm going to think us out of this one.
Selenium fibers... electrically deposited.
Sir... Dirgo is dead.
Sir... please... stay with me...
Sir... the past three years... I've lived more than most people do in a lifetime...
Sir?
That's it! The frequency went to forty.
The Academy?
The E-M pattern again -- the power level's really spiking now...

The E-M pattern is back down... it only surged when we tried to get to the water...  Whatever it was we saw... it almost acts like a sentry. To guard the fountain.  As long as we aren't moving toward the water, the wave pattern stays low... right between five and fifteen hertz... Dirgo, walk toward the fountain.
The port thruster module blew...
The readings could be indicating some electromagnetic property in the rocks... but I don't think so.
